To estimate group masses we assume an NFW profile \citep{1997ApJ...490..493N} using mass-concentration relation as derived in \citet{2008MNRAS.391.1940M}. As a result, the NFW profile only depends on the mass. See \citet{2014A&A...566A...1T} for details about gravitational radius and mass calculations. Under the assumption of an NFW profile, the group virial radius is uniquely defined with the virial mass. The virial radius is defined as the radius in which the mean density is 200 times higher than the mean density in the Universe.
